topics.body: what technology are you guys hoping for?
topics.author: 4fe3df367f123b517900066a

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53f15ce76368725d91b10000#post_53f15ce76368725d91b10000
I could explain why cybernetics can't be done right now, but it would take a long time to thoroughly explain the reasons why.

Simply put WAY too fucking expensive for it to actually be done fully.  To use a analogy it'd be like if someone in 1500 spent a hundred billion dollars in today's money for a car.  Sure you could get it done if you spent enough money to get enough people to develop it but it would be a experimental prototype and the only one and it would cost a hundred billion dollars to make.  You could theoretically make someone a full cyborg but it'd be really fucking expensive and you'd only be able to make the one.

The people that go, "well if I don't have it now it'll never happen" don't understand that in order to run a business financially successfully you need to generate a profit and dropping a hundred billion left and right just cause you feel like it is a quick ass way to go bankrupt.

Asking people to wait a decade for something in the experimental prototype phase to come out isn't that much to ask.

"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53f15f056368725f1a1e0100#post_53f15f056368725f1a1e0100
Brain-machine interfaces that can be hooked up to your nervous system; it's being worked on right now, but it's the single greatest barrier to cyborgs; once we have that we're golden.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53f15f056368725f1a1e0100#post_53f15f056368725f1a1e0100
I would like to see a Virtual reality type thing that can be applied directly to your mind or something. (That mainly acts like a more advanced version of Garry's mod.)

With something like that, It could be possible to act out some of the more impossible fetishes.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
Yes, I'm aware that it's very unlikely.

After looking at my profile pic for a bit, I suddenly want Eeveelution hoodies.

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53f162bc6368723317750000#post_53f162bc6368723317750000
That's going to take five to ten years. Five years for something that can give you some level of touch; i.e. "feeling" a object, ten years for the full ten miles.

topics.body:
Ukraine has almost gained control of Luhansk.  The last large city that is still completely under rebel control is Izvaryne.

Tl:dr of why this is important; the rebels are screwed and are close to their last alamo stand.

Izvaryne is going to be a hell of a blood bath though cause it's right on the border of Russia so yeah the alamo analogy is right.  We're talking the rebels probably falling back to Izvaryne combined with Russian forces doing a last stand.
